articles.author: Andrew Gray, Sabine Siebold, Jeff Mason
articles.description: NATO leaders gather in The Hague on Wednesday for a summit tailor-made for U.S. President Donald Trump, with European allies hoping a pledge to hike defence spending will prompt him to dispel doubts about his commitment to the alliance.
articles.title: NATO leaders set to back Trump defence spending goal at Hague summit

articles.author: Gram Slattery, Alexander Cornwell, Parisa Hafezi
articles.description: The ceasefire brokered by U.S. President Donald Trump between Iran and Israel appeared to be holding on Wednesday a day after both countries signalled that their air war had ended, at least for now.
articles.title: Fragile ceasefire holding, Trump envoy says peace talks with Iran 'promising'

articles.author: Andrew Gray, Sabine Siebold, Lili Bayer, Anthony Deutsch
articles.description: Lavishing praise, playing the royal card and copying his slogans – NATO pulled out all the stops to keep Donald Trump happy and hold the alliance together at a summit in The Hague.
articles.title: NATO's Trump flattery buys time but dodges tough questions

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Wednesday that the intelligence following the strikes on Iranian nuclear sites was inconclusive, but also suggested the damage could have been severe.
articles.title: Trump says intelligence on Iran was inconclusive, but suggests severe damage

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A South Korean court rejected on Wednesday a request to issue an arrest warrant for former President Yoon Suk Yeol related to an investigation into his short-lived attempt to impose martial law, his lawyers said.
articles.title: South Korea court rejects arrest warrant for ex-president Yoon

articles.author: Jeff Mason, Yuliia Dysa
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump indicated on Wednesday he will consider providing more of the Patriot missiles that Ukraine needs to defend against mounting Russian strikes, adding that Russian President Vladimir Putin "really has to end that war".
articles.title: Trump considers more Patriots for Ukraine, says Putin "has to end" the war

articles.author: Alexander Cornwell
articles.description: The Israeli military said seven soldiers were killed in a single attack in southern Gaza on Tuesday, the military's deadliest day in the territory since it broke a ceasefire with Hamas in March.
articles.title: Seven Israeli soldiers killed in Gaza, pressure on Netanyahu for ceasefire

articles.author: Lucy Papachristou
articles.description: Armenian authorities on Wednesday arrested a prominent Christian cleric, Archbishop Bagrat Galstanyan, along with 13 other people and charged them with orchestrating a plot to overthrow the government.
articles.title: Armenia arrests archbishop over alleged coup plot

articles.author: Edwin Okoth, Humphrey Malalo
articles.description: Fifty-six people were hospitalised, most of them with bullet wounds, after participating in rallies in Kenya on Wednesday to mark the one-year anniversary of deadly protests against a tax bill, a hospital source told Reuters.
articles.title: Protests in Kenya leave dozens hospitalised, many with bullet wounds

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Qatar Airways said on Wednesday that all of the roughly 20,000 passengers who were on flights that were diverted on Monday night after Iran fired missiles towards a U.S. military base in the Gulf country were put on new flights within 24 hours.
articles.title: Qatar Airways passengers on diverted flights all put on new flights within 24 hours, CEO says
